Solutions Architect (SA) is a key pre-sales technical position in Alibaba Cloud international business division. Our solution architects are experienced cloud architects with comprehensive IT knowledge and industry insight and are, ultimately, the key to success on implementing projects. Solutions Architects are responsible for developing solutions in Alibaba Cloud and helping customers and partners to develop their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
Responsibilities:
Closely work with customers to ensure their cloud architecture is successfully implemented by assisting them in building their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
- Create and present solution architecture designs to C-level/senior personnel.
- Responsible for understanding the unique requirements of customers and partners, and provide appropriate technical cloud solutions and architecture designs based on Alibaba Cloud cloud services.
- Provide assistance to Alibaba Cloud customers and partners in migrating their existing IT system onto Alibaba Cloud platforms. This includes providing migration technique support for both applications and databases.
- Responsible for demo development and testing Alibaba Cloud services.
※ Candidate who has professional Cloud Certificate from Alibaba Cloud or other Cloud vendors is preferred.
Requirements:
* A background in IT, computer science and/or cloud computing with a good understanding of networking, servers, storage systems, enterprise applications and the cloud.
* A minimum of 4 years experience working and consulting on enterprise architecture design and has a strong understanding of customer needs and requirements.
* Expert knowledge and understanding of cloud architecture design and familiar with architecture methodology and practice in internet based applications/websites. Must also be experienced with procedures and tools for application migration and cloud/virtualization/container solutions for enterprise customers.
* Familiar and hand-on experience with one of the public Clouds covering IaaS and PaaS services.
* Experience with one of the Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) technologies.
* Experience with Contianer/K8S and Serverless services and implementation, experience with SOA architecture design.
* Experience with RDS like MySQL or PostgreSQL or others, and experienced with NoSQL like Redis or MongoDB or others;
* Experience with BigData technologies like Hadoop eco-system is a plus.
* Excellent writing, proof-reading and editing skills. Able to create documentation that can express cloud architectures using text and diagrams.
* Able to work under high pressure, a quick learner with a passion for cloud technology. Able to think strategically about businesses, products and technical challenges.
* Good communication skills, a good team player and has professional attitude to work.
* Fluent in French and English, Chinese is a big plus.

description:
INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas from around the world to educate leaders who transform business and society. As a mission-driven school, INSEAD focuses on three values: open, rigorous, and entrepreneurial. As one of the world’s leading and largest graduate business schools, With campuses in Europe (France), Asia (Singapore), Middle East (Abu Dhabi) and an American Hub (San Francisco), INSEAD’s business and research spans four continents.
We are currently looking for a
Solution Architect
to join our Data & Enterprise Architecture team in the IT department. This is a permanent and full-time position, based either on our
Asia Campus in Singapore
or on our
Europe Campus in Fontainebleau, France
. A hybrid working model is in place – 3 days on campus, 2 days from home.
The Solution Architect will analyse the current state of the enterprise environment from a technical and functional point of view. He/she will develop and design the future state architecture and the roadmap to reach it, balancing risks in terms of timeline and costs while meeting business requirements and enabling capability. The Solution Architect will devise technical or functional solutions to achieve enterprise and business objectives, this effort will consistently align with the IT strategy.
Key Responsibilities include:
• Support large project implementation: (1) Formulate the solutions in which business and IT viewpoints are synthesised into a solution. (2) Develop the digital interoperability for new platforms to embed the INSEAD eco-system (3) Setup the plan for state-of-the-art operationalisation and maintenance of the new platform.
• Develop continuous integration & delivery practices in IT. Work out the best possible optimisation and automation of tasks and process(es), costing time and energy to the organisation.
• Formulate the architecture strategy and govern it: (1) Develop and communicate architectural standards (2) Add architecture consideration into business discussions to develop roadmaps and implementation plans considering a sustainable IT portfolio. (T.I.M.E from Gartner)
• Understand the enterprise needs and anticipate a major technology shift from the industry. This encompasses the need to educate/ inform the IT and school senior leadership about it so they can better prepare for the near future. It means driving the cost versus benefits, risks, impact, and technology priorities.
We are looking for a hands-on candidate who meets the following profile:
• A minimum of 5 years of professional experience with application development.
• Expert with DevSecOps practices. Hand’s on with suite of CI/CD platforms and utilities.
• Track record of enterprise architecture application (certify TOGAF is a plus).
• Expertise in process design as well as Data modelling (certify ArchiMate is a plus).
• Knowledge of Salesforce, Oracle Cloud and ServiceNow is a plus.
• Demonstrated polished consulting skills with a keen awareness of sensitive client topics, and the ability to navigate client messaging and recommendations tactfully.
• Proven ability to establish credibility with Senior Executives, team members and external partners, with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills for managing large and small projects.
• Strong prioritization skills with attention to detail, and the capability to quickly define dependencies, issues, and mitigation plans against risks.
• Effective communication skills bridging technology and business communities, with a consistent track record of business-building successes.
• Fluency in English, with proficiency in French is advantageous.

*.

Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications
Panel interviews are anticipated for May 2024
Purpose
You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
Look no further – your next career opportunity awaits!
Operating Network
The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
Accountabilities
Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT’s contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.
Coordinate with other IT teams in the context of their IT projects, provide effort and cost estimates for IT Integration contribution to the projects and supervise the execution of tasks assigned to IT Integration.
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology, Information Management or related field.
Proven experience as an Integration Solution Architect or similar role.
At least 5 years’ relevant professional experience of design and implementation of software Solutions.
Proven experience and excellent technical knowledge of the tools and architecture of the Integration stack, including API Management, Event Streaming, Enterprise Service Bus. Data Virtualization, message-oriented middleware, SOA and microservice enabling technologies would be an asset.
Broad and deep experience working in varied software development platforms and environments such as Java, Python, JavaScript, vendor packages, and Tomcat/JBoss.
Hands-on experience with web services, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Knowledge of security aspects of integrated system design and associated protocols, including token-based authorization and encryption.
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (**), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.

description:
À propos d’Eneflow
Enexflow accompagne des acteurs clés du secteur de l’énergie dans la mise en place de solutions innovantes de gestion d’actifs décarbonés (solaire, éolien, hydro, effacement, EV, gestion de la flexibilité) pour les valoriser sur les marchés électriques.
Nous conseillons les entreprises dans le domaine de l’énergie sur les sujets métier et technologique de l’ensemble du cycle de vie d’un produit digital, de la conception stratégique jusqu’à l’implémentation et le support opérationnel pour une amélioration continue.
Face au besoin de se diriger vers une société plus durable, nous sommes persuadés du rôle clé que les technologies numériques jouent dans l'intégration des ressources décarbonées au système énergétique de demain.
Enexflow fait partie du groupe Inthy, acteur innovant de la transition énergétique qui développe des projets d’énergies renouvelables et offre des solutions de mobilité décarbonée.
Les principales missions du poste
En tant que Solution Architect, vous intervenez sur nos activités de conseil auprès d’énergéticiens et d’entreprises technologiques. Vous accompagnez les équipes de développement à travers les différentes étapes de la mise en place du produit : définition de l’architecture cible, rédaction des tâches à accomplir, supervision de l’équipe et du développement associé, identification des risques et mise en place d’un calendrier de delivery.
Vous travaillez également en lien avec les équipes CSM (Customer Success Management) et Produit afin de prendre toute la dimension des besoins fonctionnels de nos solutions, l'objectif étant d’avoir une vue holistique sur ce qui est développé afin de faire les choix technologiques les plus pertinents.
En tant que Solution and Software Architect :
Vous définissez, en concertation avec les développeurs, les choix d’architecture les plus pertinents pour nos solutions logicielles (hébergement, design des interfaces d’échanges, sécurité…)
Vous fournissez les recommandations techniques à l’équipe de développement et organisez leur travail en les accompagnants au quotidien
Vous assurez la synchronisation des activités liées à l’intégration avec des parties tiers (intégration API avec les marchés, les TSOs, …)
Vous participez activement au développement et à l’implémentation des services en charge de la récupération, de la transformation et de l’envoi de données aux parties tiers
Vous mettez en place et pilotez des solutions de suivi de la production (monitoring infra, applicatif, …)
Vous garantissez la qualité technique de ce qui est livré par l’équipe et le maintien en condition opérationnelle des solutions logicielles et troubleshooting
Vous communiquez avec les équipes CSM et Produit l’état d’avancement des différentes fonctionnalités
Vous maintenez fonctionnelle une infrastructure logicielle de traitement de données en temps-réel.
Vous recueillez les besoins fonctionnels en liaison avec les équipes CSM et Produit et les convertissez en spécifications techniques permettant d’alimenter l’équipe de développement
Vous interagissez directement avec le client sur les sujets technologiques
Vous vous informez de manière continue sur les nouvelles technologies à disposition qui permettraient d’accélérer notre développement
Notre stack logicielle :
Microservices hébergées sur un cluster Kubernetes EKS
Gitops : Déploiement des microservices avec ArgoCD
Développement principalement en Python avec quelques services en Go
Middleware d’échange : kafka, MQTT
Base de données : Influx, Hbase
Protocoles industriels pour communication avec les assets : OPCUA, Modbus, ICCP
Utilisation de la solution Ignition de Inductive Automation pour la partie SCADA (connections aux assets, logiques métier, alerting, Interface utilisateur)
Votre profil
Vous êtes diplômé d’une école d'ingénieur
Vous justifiez d’une première expérience d’au moins 3 ans en développement, de la maîtrise des outils de développement collaboratifs (Git, CI/CD), de la connaissance des concepts d’architecture logicielle, de la capacité à organiser une équipe et gérer un projet.
Vous avez mené plusieurs projets en utilisant un langage de programmation backend. (Python, nodejs, java), dans un contexte d’architecture logicielle
Vous parlez couramment français et pouvez utiliser l’anglais dans un contexte professionnel
Une expérience dans le secteur de l’énergie et une pratique du développement logiciel dans l’infrastructure cloud (AWS, AZURE, , GCP) seraient des avantages supplémentaires
En plus d’une expertise Tech sur l’architecture logicielle, cette position exige rigueur, sens de l’organisation et du relationnel pour pouvoir accompagner les collaborateurs chargés du développement.
Le rôle demande également de la flexibilité, de la proactivité et de l’autonomie pour contribuer efficacement au développement d’Enexflow.

Un premier contact au niveau RH
Un échange par téléphone de 30 minutes avec un membre de l’équipe
Un entretien technique avec préparation d’un cas pratique en amont, si possible dans nos locaux parisiens
Un dernier entretien avec un dirigeant
Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi
Évoluer dans un secteur qui est au cœur des grands enjeux actuels : indépendance énergétique, développement d’une filière industrielle française et européenne, soutien du monde agricole, décarbonation de la mobilité et de l’industrie.
Rejoindre une équipe pluridisciplinaire, engagée et passionnée par la transition énergétique évoluant dans un environnement collaboratif et convaincue que la diversité des profils est un atout dans notre recherche de l’excellence.
Travailler dans un environnement stimulant, une entreprise dont la culture d’innovation, de proximité et d’intégrité s’exprime au quotidien.
Profiter d’un cadre de travail agréable au sein de nos bureaux situés au centre de Paris (Saint-Lazare).
S’acclimater à travers un parcours d’onboarding sur-mesure.
Profiter des nombreux avantages : tickets restaurants, 50% du titre de transport pris en charge, assurance santé complémentaire, prévoyance, kit matériel complet, prime de vacances, bonus de cooptation…
S’organiser de manière souple, télétravail accepté
Participer à de nombreux événements d’équipe sociaux, culturels, sportifs.
Apprendre, toujours (formations, Inthy Academy).

An endless horizon of professional growth, learning opportunities, and the chance to contribute to a future where better health is a global reality.

description:
Teads has an engineering team that brings together
200+ talented individuals
in 3 main locations (
Montpellier, Paris, and Bucharest
). We are organized in agile and autonomous
feature teams
and share technical knowledge within several
communities of practice
.
We promote diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment to enable all employees to feel valued and respected, which fosters creativity and innovation by allowing constructive collaboration and open exchange of ideas.
Our organization offers the opportunity for hybrid work, allowing for two days in the office and the option to work remotely for the remainder of the week. Additionally, we provide relocation packages for those who prefer to relocate to one of our engineering offices.
👉 Join a team of passionate people who build quality and responsible advertising, at scale!
Our Branding Team
The Branding team is responsible for developing components and features that empower advertisers and agencies to craft compelling Branding campaigns, within an omnichannel framework (spanning in-article, in-stream, and CTV mediums).
Our team works across the whole chain of campaign setup and delivery, covering both backend and frontend aspects. Our primary contribution is directed towards enhancing the usability of Teads Ad Manager, our campaign management system, while improving the code base.
Our main Engineering challenges at Teads
Working in a very high-traffic environment (1.9 billion users per month, 100 billion events per day) with low latency and high availability constraints (2 million requests per second, responses in less than 150 milliseconds).
Rich and diverse tech stack and system architecture to optimize for performance, scalability, resiliency, and cost efficiency. We use mostly Scala and TypeScript, among others.
Management of large datasets with milliseconds order of magnitude access time, to compute in a near real-time complex auction resolution algorithm (18 million predictions per second).
Build efficient and easy-to-use web products used by thousands of users working for the world's most premium publishers, advertisers, and agencies.
A fast-changing environment where we continuously collaborate with Product teams and constantly adapt our Cloud infrastructure for new features and Products.
Bring a wide diversity of profiles to the same level of quality and knowledge.
What will you do?
As a
Senior Software Engineer
, your mission will be to:
Collaborate with a variety of teams to develop complex services.
Create, design, develop, test, and monitor your code in production autonomously and reliably.
Work with the Engineering Manager to frame projects and be accountable for their execution.
Obtain a good understanding of the business to provide relevant solutions to clients.
Be a work facilitator and help communication inside and outside Teads.
Stay up-to-date on new technologies and architectures. If they can solve a problem Teads has, propose ways to implement them into our current software engineering process.
What will you bring to the team?
Good programming abilities. Testing your code is second nature to you. You are very mindful of your application’s architecture, performance, maintainability, and overall quality.
Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively within a team. You are an active listener and a dialogue facilitator, you know how to explain your decision and like sharing your knowledge.
Multiple shipped projects in Software Engineering.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Why work at Teads?
At Teads, Product and Engineering work hand in hand and are aligned towards the same goal: to
scale our business
while continuing to create
new and exciting products
.
We value team spirit, pragmatism, listening and we encourage initiatives.
We promote end-to-end development: “You build it, you run it, you monitor it”.
We share knowledge and support with each other beyond any organizational boundary.
We fix issues during a blameless postmortem and learn from it so that it doesn’t happen twice.
We are working together to create great engineering, but we are also supportive to promote a great work-life balance.
We Care About You
Security & Savings: Attractive package providing financial peace of mind, including competitive compensation, profit-sharing, daily meal vouchers (Swile), family health insurance (Alan), and a personalized relocation package (if needed).
Career Development: Continuous investment in our employees' skills: in-house and external training, tech conference opportunities, internal mobility (individual contributor or management career ladder).
Life Balance: A well-balanced work-life for our employees is one of our top priorities: 35+ days off per year, hybrid work (2-3 days remote work per week, more is open to discussion), fully covered parental leave, and reserved daycare places.
Wellness: Prioritizing employee well-being through premium work equipment, enjoyable work environment (work-life balance, team building events, summits), remote work subsidy, promoting Diversity & Inclusion with internal & external initiatives (women speaking groups, dedicated school partnerships), dedicated charitable time and sustainability actions (Eco Tree, subsidy for eco-mobility).
Discover more about our culture and benefits on our Engineering website.
What are our recruitment process steps?
We want to get to know you and we try to give you the insight you need to make an informed decision to join us. For that, you can find all the information in our Engineering hiring process article!
About Teads
Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media.
As an end-to-end solution, Teads’ modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies. For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world’s best publishers and content providers.
Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.
Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries.
We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.

The
EIB
, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
(Senior) Integration Solution Architect
*.
This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications
Panel interviews are anticipated for May 2024
Purpose
You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
Look no further – your next career opportunity awaits!
Operating Network
The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
Accountabilities
Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT’s contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.
Coordinate with other IT teams in the context of their IT projects, provide effort and cost estimates for IT Integration contribution to the projects and supervise the execution of tasks assigned to IT Integration.
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology, Information Management or related field.
Proven experience as an Integration Solution Architect or similar role.
At least 5 years’ relevant professional experience of design and implementation of software Solutions.
Proven experience and excellent technical knowledge of the tools and architecture of the Integration stack, including API Management, Event Streaming, Enterprise Service Bus. Data Virtualization, message-oriented middleware, SOA and microservice enabling technologies would be an asset.
Broad and deep experience working in varied software development platforms and environments such as Java, Python, JavaScript, vendor packages, and Tomcat/JBoss.
Hands-on experience with web services, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Knowledge of security aspects of integrated system design and associated protocols, including token-based authorization and encryption.
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (**), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies
here

Architecte Solutions

Vos missions
Conduire l’amélioration continue de l'offre d’hébergement et être force de proposition en ce sens.
• Rationaliser, standardiser et améliorer la proposition de valeur de l’offre d’hébergement dans un contexte multicloud & hébergement classique.

À propos d’Eneflow
Enexflow accompagne des acteurs clés du secteur de l’énergie dans la mise en place de solutions innovantes de gestion d’actifs décarbonés (solaire, éolien, hydro, effacement, EV, gestion de la flexibilité) pour les valoriser sur les marchés électriques.
Nous conseillons les entreprises dans le domaine de l’énergie sur les sujets métier et technologique de l’ensemble du cycle de vie d’un produit digital, de la conception stratégique jusqu’à l’implémentation et le support opérationnel pour une amélioration continue.
Face au besoin de se diriger vers une société plus durable, nous sommes persuadés du rôle clé que les technologies numériques jouent dans l'intégration des ressources décarbonées au système énergétique de demain.
Enexflow fait partie du groupe Inthy, acteur innovant de la transition énergétique qui développe des projets d’énergies renouvelables et offre des solutions de mobilité décarbonée.
Les principales missions du poste
En tant que Solution Architect, vous intervenez sur nos activités de conseil auprès d’énergéticiens et d’entreprises technologiques. Vous accompagnez les équipes de développement à travers les différentes étapes de la mise en place du produit : définition de l’architecture cible, rédaction des tâches à accomplir, supervision de l’équipe et du développement associé, identification des risques et mise en place d’un calendrier de delivery.
Vous travaillez également en lien avec les équipes CSM (Customer Success Management) et Produit afin de prendre toute la dimension des besoins fonctionnels de nos solutions, l'objectif étant d’avoir une vue holistique sur ce qui est développé afin de faire les choix technologiques les plus pertinents.
En tant que Solution and Software Architect :
Vous définissez, en concertation avec les développeurs, les choix d’architecture les plus pertinents pour nos solutions logicielles (hébergement, design des interfaces d’échanges, sécurité…)
Vous fournissez les recommandations techniques à l’équipe de développement et organisez leur travail en les accompagnants au quotidien
Vous assurez la synchronisation des activités liées à l’intégration avec des parties tiers (intégration API avec les marchés, les TSOs, …)
Vous participez activement au développement et à l’implémentation des services en charge de la récupération, de la transformation et de l’envoi de données aux parties tiers
Vous mettez en place et pilotez des solutions de suivi de la production (monitoring infra, applicatif, …)
Vous garantissez la qualité technique de ce qui est livré par l’équipe et le maintien en condition opérationnelle des solutions logicielles et troubleshooting
Vous communiquez avec les équipes CSM et Produit l’état d’avancement des différentes fonctionnalités
Vous maintenez fonctionnelle une infrastructure logicielle de traitement de données en temps-réel.
Vous recueillez les besoins fonctionnels en liaison avec les équipes CSM et Produit et les convertissez en spécifications techniques permettant d’alimenter l’équipe de développement
Vous interagissez directement avec le client sur les sujets technologiques
Vous vous informez de manière continue sur les nouvelles technologies à disposition qui permettraient d’accélérer notre développement
Notre stack logicielle :
Microservices hébergées sur un cluster Kubernetes EKS
Gitops : Déploiement des microservices avec ArgoCD
Développement principalement en Python avec quelques services en Go
Middleware d’échange : kafka, MQTT
Base de données : Influx, Hbase
Protocoles industriels pour communication avec les assets : OPCUA, Modbus, ICCP
Utilisation de la solution Ignition de Inductive Automation pour la partie SCADA (connections aux assets, logiques métier, alerting, Interface utilisateur)
Votre profil
Vous êtes diplômé d’une école d'ingénieur
Vous justifiez d’une première expérience d’au moins 3 ans en développement, de la maîtrise des outils de développement collaboratifs (Git, CI/CD), de la connaissance des concepts d’architecture logicielle, de la capacité à organiser une équipe et gérer un projet.
Vous avez mené plusieurs projets en utilisant un langage de programmation backend. (Python, nodejs, java), dans un contexte d’architecture logicielle
Vous parlez couramment français et pouvez utiliser l’anglais dans un contexte professionnel
Une expérience dans le secteur de l’énergie et une pratique du développement logiciel dans l’infrastructure cloud (AWS, AZURE, , GCP) seraient des avantages supplémentaires
En plus d’une expertise Tech sur l’architecture logicielle, cette position exige rigueur, sens de l’organisation et du relationnel pour pouvoir accompagner les collaborateurs chargés du développement.
Le rôle demande également de la flexibilité, de la proactivité et de l’autonomie pour contribuer efficacement au développement d’Enexflow.
Notre processus de recrutement
Un premier contact au niveau RH
Un échange par téléphone de 30 minutes avec un membre de l’équipe
Un entretien technique avec préparation d’un cas pratique en amont, si possible dans nos locaux parisiens
Un dernier entretien avec un dirigeant
Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi
Évoluer dans un secteur qui est au cœur des grands enjeux actuels : indépendance énergétique, développement d’une filière industrielle française et européenne, soutien du monde agricole, décarbonation de la mobilité et de l’industrie.
Rejoindre une équipe pluridisciplinaire, engagée et passionnée par la transition énergétique évoluant dans un environnement collaboratif et convaincue que la diversité des profils est un atout dans notre recherche de l’excellence.
Travailler dans un environnement stimulant, une entreprise dont la culture d’innovation, de proximité et d’intégrité s’exprime au quotidien.
Profiter d’un cadre de travail agréable au sein de nos bureaux situés au centre de Paris (Saint-Lazare).
S’acclimater à travers un parcours d’onboarding sur-mesure.
Profiter des nombreux avantages : tickets restaurants, 50% du titre de transport pris en charge, assurance santé complémentaire, prévoyance, kit matériel complet, prime de vacances, bonus de cooptation…
S’organiser de manière souple, télétravail accepté
Participer à de nombreux événements d’équipe sociaux, culturels, sportifs.
Apprendre, toujours (formations, Inthy Academy).
